instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
The board is clean, no water damage at all.
However, the board is dead.

This is my first time working on this new board, i just got the schematics and looks a little bit different.

Any hint from where can i start look?

FB200 = 5V , however, i was supposed to get 20V, right?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message: Voltage on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>? Always check <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> when you have 5 volts on DC in.

threads.message: Resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>? <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> for sure 5 volts steady?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
If no short to ground at L6900, post <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> voltages.
Also check resistance to ground at pin 2.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
Pin 10 voltage needed too.
If present (3V), then change <CHIP>U5903</CHIP>.
If missing, post some voltage for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>.
